titleStmt.title: D. C. Wilcox et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4455

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
McCracken County
To his excellency
Govr. Bramlet

We the undersigned citizens of Said State and county being desirous that Justice should be meted out every citizen we therefore respectfully petition your exelency to remit a fine imposed upon one of our worthy citizens by the circuit court of this county for the alledged offence of Suffering gaming in his house which we believe was a malicious thing on the part of the individual who made the present ^ment^ to the grand Jury the individual thus imposed upon is William Wood of this county whom we know to be a gentleman and the Expert to the Grand Jury was wholely and malicious the amt of the fine is two hundred Dollars $200 which the Shff of this is according to Law obliged to collect unless you remit

Names
D C Wilcox
W. T. Carlan
B Small
S. R. Fuller
J. W. Ogilvie
Jas Moss
G M Ratcliffe
Names
Henry Eichar
J S Smedsey
R C Campbell
G. W. Panett
Geo A. L. Wright
W. S Rearden
Daniel A Hammond
D. W. Rawleigh
C. C Purcell
T. Smedley
Philip Mann
S. B. Stone
A. Grace
S. H. Butts
G. D. Greer
J R George
H. C. Meyers.
L G Carlan
L B Dunn
A. B. Kinkead

Remit except fees & costs
Refused
Ansd
5th Dec/ 63
McCracken
County
